business.headline: Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 25,500; HUL gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 9.61 points higher at 83,442.50, while the NSE Nifty remained flat to end below 25,500.
GCCs push India's office leasing to new heights: ReportGCCs are no longer coming to India just for cheaper costs. They now see India as a strong base for talent, innovation and large modern offices.

Sebi to intensify watch on derivatives trading after Jane Street episodeIndia is currently the world's largest equity derivatives market. According to the Futures Industry Association, it accounted for nearly 60% of the derivatives contracts traded globally in April.

EMIs hurt India's middle class more than inflation, says financial expertToday, almost everything is available on easy monthly instalments, from a new phone to flight tickets, even groceries. What was once a helpful option has now turned into a lifestyle. However, this is silently eating into people's income, leaving little room for savings or emergencies.

Filing ITR for the first time? 7 common errors new taxpayers must avoidFiling your ITR is not enough. You must verify it too. If you forget, the tax department treats it as if you never filed it at all. You can e-verify using Aadhaar OTP, net banking, or by sending a signed physical copy. Without verification, your return stays incomplete.

House rent above Rs 50,000? Here's the TDS rule you need to knowFor tenants living in high-rent homes, the line between a routine payment and a tax lapse can be thinner than it seems, and ignoring it can invite penalties that quickly snowball.

HUL shares gain 2% today. Should you buy the FMCG stock?HUL share price: The stock has gained 3.67% in the last five trading sessions. However, when looking at a longer time frame, the stock is still down 7.97% over the past year.

Lost Rs 18 lakh in 6 months: Financial advisor's warning on online bettingWhat begins as casual fun can spiral into secrecy, debt, and broken trust. A financial advisor warns that, without strong regulation, betting apps are fast becoming one of India's biggest financial threats.

Tariffs on steel, auto unlikely in interim trade deal with US: Government sourcesWith the US to soon notify countries of higher tariffs by July 9, with new rates effective August 1, sectoral levies on steel, auto and aluminium are unlikely in the India-US interim trade deal, government sources said.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 65.28 points to 83,367.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 16.45 points to 25,444.55 as of 9:50 am.

Trump reveals tariff letter plan with a twist: Here's what's coming nextTrump also said that any country supporting what he called the 'Anti-American policies' of the BRICS group will face an additional 10% tariff.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump singals delay in tariffs?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,512 as of 8:08 am., suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open around its previous close of 25,461. Sensex and Nifty declined by 0.7% each last week.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 premieres soon: Lineup, hosts, when and where to watch Salman's showIt seems like the team of 'Bigg Boss 19' is planning to get a new hosting team along with Salman Khan. Karan Johar, Farah Khan, and Anil Kapoor are potential successors. The show is anticipated to start sooner than you expect.

Exclusive: Adivi Sesh calls Dacoit the Sholay of 2025, praises co-star Mrunal ThakurAdivi Sesh is all set to surprise audiences with his next, 'Dacoit'. The film, which also features Mrunal Thakur and Anurag Kashyap, promises an emotional neo-Western experience hitting theatres on December 25, 2025.

Zayn Malik hints at facing racism during One Direction days in new songZayn Malik recently shared the lyrics of his upcoming song, 'Fuchsia Sea', on social media. The song suggests that he experienced racial discrimination during his One Direction days.

YouTuber Purav Jha responds to Jasmin Bhasin calling Apoorva Mukhija ill-manneredYouTuber Purav Jha stood by his friend and 'The Traitors' co-star Apoorva Mukhija, aka Rebel Kid, in a recent interview. He highlighted that Apoorva's bold personality is appreciated by her audience.

Panchayat Season 5 confirmed for 2026 after Season 4 breaks franchise recordsThe new season of TVF's 'Panchayat' has been renewed for 2026. After the success of season 4, the Prime Video series has confirmed season 5 of the comedy-drama series.

Smriti Irani's first official look from Kyunkii Saas... is pure nostalgia. See picActor Smriti Irani reprises her iconic character - Tulsi Virani - in the new season of the popular show 'Kyunkii Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi.' The actor's first-look from the show is now out and being circulated on social media.

Grateful that it happened to me: Apoorva Mukhija on India's Got Latent controversySocial media influencer Apoorva Mukhija expressed gratitude for 'India's Got Latent' row. She reflected on how the controversy led to personal growth and detachment from online negativity.

James Gunn says Superman is an immigrant story, may not resonate with allThe upcoming film 'Superman', directed by James Gunn, is portrayed as a tale of America through the eyes of an immigrant seeking hope and purpose. It delves into themes of basic human kindness, morality, and politics, highlighting the contrasting beliefs between Superman and Lois Lane.

Zareen Khan shares fangirl moment with Katrina Kaif in an old video. WatchZareen Khan shared a throwback video of her taking Katrina Kaif's autograph at the 'Race' (2008) premiere, calling it a true fangirl moment. She recalled how she never imagined being part of the film industry back then.

Why Rashmika Mandanna's 'first Kodava actor' claim has angered her communityActor Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, called herself the first Kodava actor. Her claim has angered the artistes who had entered the film industry before her.

Ishaan Khatter changed 17 homes by age 16, calls it Bombay's struggling lifestyleActor Ishaan Khatter talked about his modest upbringing in a recent interview. He shared that he had to live in 17 different homes by the time he turned 16, citing what he called a 'Bombay struggling lifestyle'.

Andrew Garfield-Monica Barbaro twin in white, confirm relationship at Wimbledon 2025Actor Andrew Garfield and his girlfriend, Monica Barbaro, were twinning in white at Wimbledon 2025 while sharing sweet PDA moments. The couple were rumoured to be dating since earlier this year.
Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali celebrates his mother's 75th birthday in PahalgamFilmmaker Imtiaz Ali celebrated his mother's 75th birthday in Pahalgam, sharing moments from the celebration on social media.

Gurmeet Choudhary honoured with Bihar Gaurav Award, says forever a proud BihariActor Gurmeet Choudhary was honoured with the Bihar Gaurav Award by Chirag Paswan and Governor Arif Mohammed Khan for his contributions to entertainment. Calling it a proud moment, the actor shared photos from the event and said that Biharis are known by their actions, not words.

Raghav Juyal's Kill gets a Tamil remake, Dhruv Vikram to play lead: ReportsThe Bollywood action-thriller 'Kill', featuring Lakshya and Raghav Juyal, is set for a Tamil remake. The film might have Dhruv Vikram as the lead.

Here's how much Ranbir Kapoor is being paid for the two Ramayana filmsActor Ranbir Kapoor is set to earn a hefty sum for his role in the two-part Ramayana films. The project promises a visual spectacle and features a star-studded cast, aiming to captivate a global audience.

Actor Mahesh Babu gets legal notice for promoting real estate firmTelugu star Mahesh Babu has been issued a legal notice by the Rangareddy District Consumer Commission over his role as a brand ambassador for a real estate firm accused of misleading consumers.

Fool Volume trailer: Vir Das brings wit, wisdom and laughter in new standup showThe trailer of 'Vir Das: Fool Volume' released on July 7. The upcoming Netflix standup comedy show is scheduled for a July 18 release.
Shah Rukh Khan to make a special appearance in Ranveer Singh's Don 3: SourcesShah Rukh Khan will reportedly make a surprising cameo in Ranveer Singh's 'Don 3'. The film is currently in works.

general news.headline: Trusted by Pak army, was part of 26/11 plan: Tahawwur Rana's explosive revelationsDuring questioning by the Mumbai Crime Branch in NIA custody, Tahawwur Rana confirmed his presence in Mumbai during the 26/11 attacks and that it was part of the terrorists' plan, sources told India Today TV.

Video: Drunk, semi-naked son of Mumbai politician abuses influencer on cameraRajshree More claimed on social media that Rahil Javed Shaikh, son of Mumbai politician Javed Shaikh, caused her accident in Mumbai.

MP Kangana Ranaut defends 'don't have cabinet' remark on Himachal flood reliefAfter her 'no cabinet post' remark while seeking disaster relief for rain-hit Himachal Pradesh, BJP MP Kangana Ranaut remained firm on her statement, saying it was not controversial and a way of expression.

Mamdani's 2015 post on al-Qaida terrorist returns to haunt himNew York City's Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani is under fire after his old tweets from 2015 resurfaced, criticising the FBI's surveillance on an al-Qaida terrorist, Anwar al-Awlaki. Critics, including 9/11 victims' families and government officials, are accusing Mamdani of undermining US' counterterrorism efforts.

We match in everything…except sexThey laugh together, parent well, plan their future, but there is one aspect that keeps them distant - their sex life. Welcome to the quietly simmering struggle of sexual desire discrepancy, a dynamic more couples experience than admit.

Turkish aviation firm's plea against security clearance revocation dismissedDismissing the Turkish firm's plea, the Delhi High Court pointed out that judicially evolved principles -- recognised across jurisdictions -- give primacy to legitimate national security considerations, even when weighed against the procedural due process.

Voter rolls revision is legal, moral and essential. So, what's the problem?An intensive vetting of electoral rolls is a must to ensure that only Indian citizens get to decide on the country's politics and policy. If the Election Commission (EC) is mandated to conduct a special intensive revision (SIR) of voter lists, why is there such opposition to the exercise in Bihar from political parties?

Don't worry about me, do well for India: Akash Deep's sister amid cancer battleIndia pacer Akash Deep delivered a remarkable 10-wicket haul at Edgbaston and dedicated it to his sister battling cancer. In an exclusive interview with Aajtak, Akash Deep's sister reacted to her brother's viral interview and her own cancer treatment.

Smriti Irani's first official look from Kyunkii Saas... is pure nostalgia. See picActor Smriti Irani reprises her iconic character - Tulsi Virani - in the new season of the popular show 'Kyunkii Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi.' The actor's first-look from the show is now out and being circulated on social media.

Munir hails Pak Kargil War hero, but a letter from India revealed his bravery firstAs Pakistan Army Chief Asim Munir, along with the top military brass, paid tribute to Kargil War hero, Captain Karnal Sher Khan, on his 26th martyrdom anniversary, it's worth remembering that it was an Indian Brigadier's letter that first ensured Khan's bravery didn't go unrecognised. Pakistan had initially disowned Sher Khan and refused to claim his body from Indian soil.

Brics not seeking confrontation: China calls Trump's tariff threat coercion toolThe Chinese foreign ministry said that the use of tariffs benefits no one and opposed the idea of using tariffs as a tool to coerce others.

Everybody has desires: DK Shivakumar on Karnataka seer's leadership pact remarkA top Lingayat Panchamasali seer in Karnataka backed DK Shivakumar for Chief Minister and urged Congress to honour their leadership pact. Shivakumar, however, said decisions rest with the high command. Dinesh Gundu Rao questioned the seer's political comments.

Are you caught in the 'wellness trap'? When self-care backfires on mental healthGreen smoothies to gratitude journals, India's self-care boom does promise healing. But is it also quietly triggering anxiety and burnout instead? Doctors say health is at the receiving end of this burden of "being well"

Shux calls Isro chief from Space Station. Here's what they discussedIsr0 chief discussed mission progress with the Indian astronaut on the ISS. He emphasised documenting experiments for India's future human space programme.

Where is Xi Jinping amid China's military purge?Chinese President Xi Jinping's absence from public view, appearing only twice in videos in over a month, amid a military purge and economic challenges, has fuelled speculation of a power shift in the Chinese Communist Party. With former President Hu Jintao's allies reportedly gaining influence, Xi's absence from the Brics summit has raised questions.

Pet lion creates panic on Lahore street, mauls family as owners stand and watchA pet lion escaped from a Lahore farmhouse and mauled a woman and her two children. The shocking attack was caught on video, with the lion's owners seen watching without stepping in. The victims suffered serious injuries before the lion was captured and sent to a wildlife park.

Selfish Norris, Piastri slammed for ignoring Hulkenberg on British GP podiumNico Hulkenberg secured his first ever Formula 1 podium at the British Grand Prix. At the celebrations, he was ignored by both McLaren drivers.

Indian man calmly walks away after racist rant by American in viral videoThe viral video shows an Indian man being confronted by an American who begins filming and unleashing a racist tirade without any provocation at what appears to be a parking spot.

No more 'kabootar khanas' in Mumbai: Why state ordered closure of feeding zonesShiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande said these 'kabootar khanas' pose a danger to the people living around them as their waste and feathers lead to respiratory diseases.

Forced to eat beef, convert religion: Indore woman accuses husband of 'love jihad'A woman from Indore alleged mental and physical harassment by her husband in Bihar over her refusal to eat beef and convert her religion. She approached police seeking to return home, while the husband denied all allegations.

Here's how much Ranbir Kapoor is being paid for the two Ramayana filmsActor Ranbir Kapoor is set to earn a hefty sum for his role in the two-part Ramayana films. The project promises a visual spectacle and features a star-studded cast, aiming to captivate a global audience.

Did Army General admit India's defeat to Pakistan? Centre's one-word clarificationPakistani propaganda posts claiming Lt Gen Rahul Singh admitted India's defeat in the recent conflict with are fake, the PIB has clarified, dismissing the viral quotes as completely baseless claims.

Why China ran disinformation campaign against Rafale jets after India's Op SindoorTo hammer the Rafale fighter jets' reputation, China's foreign missions sought to persuade countries that ordered the French-made fighter not to buy them and encourage others to go for Chinese-made planes.

Suspicious boat, likely from Pak, spotted off Maharashtra coast; state on alertSecurity was heightened after a suspicious boat, believed to bear Pakistani markings, was sighted near the Revdanda coast in Maharashtra's Raigad district.

sports.headline: Wimbledon Live Updates, Day 8: Djokovic, Sinner headline in Round of 16 stagesWimbledon 2025 Day 8 Live Updates: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner take the spotlight as they are set to feature in the Round of 16 stages for the Men's singles division. Iga Swiatek will also be in action in the Women's singles division as well.

Wiian Mulder hits 2nd fastest triple hundred in Test cricket historyWiian Mulder became the first ever captain to score a triple hundred in Test cricket. His 297-ball innings is the second fastest, just behind Virender Sehwag's record.

F1: Oscar Piastri brake-checks himself out of victory in British Grand PrixLando Norris claimed a dramatic win at Silverstone after Oscar Piastri brake-checked himself into a second place finish at the British Grand Prix. Nico Hulkenberg secured his first-ever podium in a rain-hit, chaotic race.

Pat Cummins backs Sam Konstas despite inconsistent Test formAustralian captain Pat Cummins has backed young batter Sam Konstas despite his inconsistent Test performances. Cummins highlights the importance of patience and faith in emerging players during challenging phases.

Don't worry about me, do well for India: Akash Deep's sister amid cancer battleIndia pacer Akash Deep delivered a remarkable 10-wicket haul at Edgbaston and dedicated it to his sister battling cancer. In an exclusive interview with Aajtak, Akash Deep's sister reacted to her brother's viral interview and her own cancer treatment.

Shubman Gill 2.0: How Edgbaston Test marked the rise of a potential India greatENG vs IND: Shubman Gill didn't have a great record outside the subcontinent, but the young India captain has put his best foot forward in the ongoing England tour, scoring runs in heaps and guiding India to a 336-run win at Edgbaston.

ICC appoints Sanjog Gupta as Chief Executive OfficerThe International Cricket Council (ICC) has appointed Sanjog Gupta as its new chief executive officer (CEO). He will assume office on July 7, 2025, becoming the seventh CEO in the history of the ICC.

My B-game is enough: Magnus Carlsen after winning Grand Chess Tour ZagrebMagnus Carlsen clinched the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz combined title in Croatia. Carlsen reacted to his win on social media, stating that his B-game was enough to beat the others.

Flat tracks on England tour a missed opportunity for Virat Kohli?Did Virat Kohli time his Test retirement right with flat decks on offer on the ongoing England tour? Kohli's childhood coach, Rajkumar Sharma, opened up on the batter's Test retirement in a conversation with India Today.

Shubman Gill warns declining Dukes ball quality is hurting Test cricket's balanceIndia captain Shubman Gill on Sunday slammed the fast-deteriorating quality of the Dukes ball, while also giving a thumbs down to the trend of flat pitches seen in the first two Tests of the series — despite his own prolific run.

Watch: MS Dhoni celebrates his 44th birthday with friends, cake and warm wishesMS Dhoni rang in his 44th birthday on Monday with a low-key celebration in Ranchi, surrounded by close friends and familiar faces. A clip from the evening - showing the former India captain in a sleeveless T-shirt, cutting cake and sharing laughs - quickly went viral, giving fans a heartwarming glimpse into the cricketer's special day.

Selfish Norris, Piastri slammed for ignoring Hulkenberg on British GP podiumNico Hulkenberg secured his first ever Formula 1 podium at the British Grand Prix. At the celebrations, he was ignored by both McLaren drivers.

Day 8 schedule: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner, Iga Swiatek take center stageOlympic champion Novak Djokovic and world No. 1 Jannik Sinner headline a star-studded Centre Court line-up on Monday (7 July) as Wimbledon 2025 enters its second week at the All England Club.

Mexico beat USA 2-1 to retain Gold Cup, clinches record-extending 10th titleMexico overcame the United States 2-1 on Sunday at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas, to successfully defend their CONCACAF Gold Cup trophy and win their 10th title in a thrilling final that was filled with drama from start to finish.

Seam, skid and spirit: Akash Deep turns Edgbaston into spectacle of English mayhemEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Akash Deep turned Edgbaston into his personal crime scene, leaving behind a trail of shattered stumps and broken batting egos. Armed with skiddy seamers and a fearless heart, he's rewritten his story: from forgotten backup to India's dangerous weapon.

Watch: English fan sings a song for Akash Deep after Edgbaston Test heroicsEngland vs India: After helping India crush England by 336 runs to level the series at Edgbaston, Akash Deep received a heartwarming tribute — an English fan singing a song in his honour outside the stadium.

Gill prepares to hunt down Gavaskar, Bradman after epic start to seriesShubman Gill has scored three centuries in the first two Tests against England. His exceptional form puts him on track to break historic records held by Gavaskar and Bradman.

Wimbledon organisers apologise after line-calling system failureWimbledon's decision to fully rely on automated line-calling came under sharp scrutiny on Sunday after a glaring malfunction denied Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova a crucial point during her last-16 clash against Britain's Sonay Kartal on Centre Court. The system, which controversially replaced human line judges this year, failed at a key moment, sparking confusion and outrage.

The system, which controversially replaced human line judges this year, failed at a key moment, sparking confusion and outrage.

England add Gus Atkinson to bolster bowling after Edgbaston loss vs IndiaEngland vs India: England have added pacer Gus Atkinson to their squad ahead of their third Test match against India, set to be held at Lord's in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

How Akash Deep used T20 skills to dismantle Bazball in BirminghamIndia fast bowler Akash Deep successfully filled in the massive shoes of Jasprit Bumrah as he helped India register a historic win in the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham with a ten-wicket haul. He even used his T20 skills to outfox batters and dismantle England's Bazball strategy.

Jofra Archer to return at Lord's? Ben Stokes shares updateENG vs IND: Ben Stokes opened up on whether Jofra Archer would return to playing in the upcoming Lord's Test after England's 336-run defeat in the second Test at Edgbaston.
Australia crush West Indies in Grenada to secure series victoryWI vs AUS: Australia took an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series after winning the second Test by 133 runs in Grenada.

Carlos Alcaraz survives Rublev scare, Sabalenka, Fritz into quartersWimbledon: Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka booked their berths in the quarterfinals of the grass court major after beating Andrey Rublev and Elise Mertens in straight sets on Sunday.

Sunil Gavaskar backs Shubman Gill to score 1000 runs in England Test seriesSpeaking to IndiaToday.in, Sunil Gavaskar said he would be more than happy if Shubman Gill breaks his record for most runs by an Indian in a Test series. The batting great backed Gill to go past Donald Bradman's all-time tally of 974 runs and go for 100 in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Gill scored 430 runs in the second Test, which India won by 336 runs.

Shubman Gill trolls stats talk after Edgbaston win: Where's my favourite journalist?England vs India, 2nd Test: Shubman Gill took a friendly swipe at talk of history and statistics after India ended their long wait for a win in Birmingham. India defeated England by 336 runs on Sunday to seal a memorable victory.

Magnus Carlsen trolls haters after Grand Chess Tour Zagreb win, deletes post laterWorld No. 1 Magnus Carlsen won the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz Croatia on Sunday, July 06, overcoming a poor Rapid section with a stellar show in the fastest format. He took a dig at his critics with a meme before deleting the post. D Gukesh finished third after slipping in Blitz rounds.

My sister has cancer: Emotional Akash Deep dedicates Edgbaston win to brave siblingEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Akash Deep played a match-winning role in India's 336-run victory over England in Birmingham. He dedicated his 10-wicket haul to his sister, who has been battling cancer for two months.

Akash Deep goes past Jasprit Bumrah with 10-wicket match haul in BirminghamAkash Deep starred with a 10-wicket haul as India secured a historic Test victory over England at Edgbaston. His performance, combined with Shubman Gill's twin centuries, marked a landmark moment for Indian cricket abroad.

Definitely: Shubman Gill confirms Jasprit Bumrah's return at Lord'sENG vs IND: After missing the second Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham, Jasprit Bumrah will return to play when the Lord's Test starts on July 12.

India win historic Birmingham Test to end 63-year-long wait: Stat PackENG vs IND, 2nd Test: Shubman Gill's India set a plethora of records after beating Ben Stokes' England by 336 runs in the second Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham. India became the first Asian team to win a Test at the venue since 1962.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
